subsubsection.title: Interpret function notation
subsubsection.p: The definitions of the variables help us interpret function notation.

statement.p:
The number of students at Salt Creek Elementary School is growing according to the formula ~f(t)=500(1.08)^t~, where t is the number of years since the school opened in 2005.
What does the equation ~f(6)=500(1.08)^6~ tell us about the school?
Use function notation to say that the student population was 583 in 2007.

ol.li: In this equation, t=6 and f(6)=793. In 2011 (six years after the school opened), the student population was 793.

statement.p:
The value of Digicorp stock has been falling according to the formula ~V(w)=48(0.96)^w~, where w is the number of weeks since its peak value of $48 per share.
Use function notation to say that 8 weeks later the value of a share of Digicorp stock was $34.63.
What does the equation ~V(12) = 48(0.96)^{12} = 29.41~ tell us about the stock?

ol.li: We evaluate the function at w=8 to get ~V(8) = 48(0.96)^8 = 34.63.
In this equation, w=12 and V(12) = 29.41, so 12 weeks after the peak value a share of Digicorp stock was worth $29.41.

statement.p: The number of internet users in the United States is given by ~I(t) = 95,331,000(1.09)^t~, where t=0 in 2000. Use function notation to say that the number of internet users in 2005 was 146,679,000.

The percent of U.S. households that maintain a landline telephone is decreasing according to the formula ~L(t) = 95(0.96)^t~, where t=0 in 2004. What does the equation ~L(t) = 95(0.96)^{10} = 63~ tell us about landlines?

answer.p: In 2014, 63% of households maintained a landline.

assemblage.title: Doubling Time and Half-Life
assemblage.p: If D is the doubling time for an exponential function P(t), then P(t) = P_0 2^{t/D}
If H is the half-life for an exponential function Q(t), then Q(t)=Q_0 (0.5)^{t/H}

statement.p: The half-life of a cold medication in the body is 6 hours. Find its decay rate.

solution.p: The decay law for the medication is N=N_0(0.5)^{t/8} We can rewrite this expression as N=N_0(0.5^{1/8})^t so b=0.5^{1/8}=0.9170, and r=1-b=0.083. The decay rate is 8.3%.

statement.p: The growth rate of a population of badgers is 3.8% per year. Find its doubling time.
The doubling time for a population is 18 years. Find its annual growth rate.
A radioactive isotope decays by 0.04% per second. What is its half-life?
Write a decay law for the graph shown below, where t is in hours and N is in milligrams.

solution.p: The initial value is given by the vertical intercept of the graph, (0,600), so N_0 = 600.
When t=5,~N=300, so the half-life of the substance is 5 hours. Thus the decay law is N(t)=600(0.5)^{t/5}, or N(t)=600(0.87)^t.

ol.li: Write a growth law for the population whose graph is shown, where t is in years.
What is the annual growth rate for the population?
Write a decay law for the population whose graph is shown, where t is in days.
What is the daily decay rate for the population?
